instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a turn on no display
threads.message:
Unit had water damaged close to <RESISTOR>R5498</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C5549</CAPACITOR>.
<RESISTOR>R5494</RESISTOR> : 17.75v. Fan spinning normal,  CPU is not getting worm.
 Missing <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_OR_PSR_EN</SIGNAL> on pin 1 <RESISTOR>R8319</RESISTOR>
Have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> on pin 8 of <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> .
PP5VS4 is present.
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>: 1.69V
Known good display connected.
Dont know what to next, any help please.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a turn on no display
threads.message:
Pins 28-30 of J8300 must get 5V, at least in the first few seconds.
This voltage is not maintained if pins 1 & 4 of <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> don't go high.
Checl these pins and be sure L8300 is OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a turn on no display
threads.message:
Pins 28-30 of J8300=0v

1 & 4 of <CHIP>U8330</CHIP>: 0v
L8300 is OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a turn on no display
threads.message:
Did you measure in the first few seconds, when board starts?
Disconnect J8300 and test again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a turn on no display
threads.message:
Pins 28-30 of J8300= 0v (in the first few seconds, when board starts ,Disconnect J8300)

1 & 4 of <CHIP>U8330</CHIP>= 0v ,(in the first few seconds, when board starts ,Disconnect J8300)
Checked twice.

Just for test, but it will have dirty ME region...
